description: Primes of the form 36*n^2 - 810*n + 2753, listed in order of increasing parameter n >= 0.
comments: The sequence of primes of this form, in order of increasing size, would read: 89, 359, 647, 953, 1277, 1619, 1979, 2357, 2753,... - _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 18 2015
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime-Generating Polynomial
maple: t1:=[seq(36*n^2 - 810*n + 2753,n=0..100)]; t2:=[]; for i from 1 to nops(t1) do if isprime(t1[i]) then t2:=[op(t2),t1[i]]; fi; od: t2; # _N. J. A. Sloane_
prog: (PARI) select(isprime, vector(1000, n, 36*n^2-810*n+2753)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 14 2011(MAGMA) [a: n in [0..100] | IsPrime(a) where a is  36*n^2 - 810*n + 2753]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Dec 08 2011
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Definition corrected by _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 18 2015
